data: 1 00:04:20,413 --> 00:04:23,234 You are confused, aren't you? Frightened. 2 00:04:23,297 --> 00:04:25,126 That's all right. I can help you. 3 00:04:25,348 --> 00:04:26,053 Who is this? 4 00:04:26,259 --> 00:04:28,770 I am a doctor. Now, you must listen to me. You have lost... 5 00:04:28,972 --> 00:04:31,103 ...your memory. There was an experiment. 6 00:04:31,104 --> 00:04:32,898 Something went wrong. Your memory was erased. 7 00:04:33,049 --> 00:04:33,953 Do you understand me? 8 00:04:34,133 --> 00:04:36,139 No, I don't understand. What the hell is going on here? 9 00:04:36,764 --> 00:04:38,005 Just listen. There are people coming for you... 10 00:04:38,142 --> 00:04:41,266 ...even as we speak. You must not let them find you. You must leave now. 11 00:04:42,432 --> 00:04:44,078 Hello? Are you there? 12 00:05:44,144 --> 00:05:46,696 Hey, Mr. Murdoch. The Automat called. 13 00:05:46,697 --> 00:05:48,513 Said you left your wallet there. 14 00:05:49,509 --> 00:05:52,875 I suggest you retrieve it since you only paid for 3 weeks... 15 00:05:52,876 --> 00:05:54,831 ...and they was up 10 minutes ago. 16 00:05:56,753 --> 00:05:58,300 I've been here 3 weeks? 17 00:05:58,320 --> 00:06:01,153 It's right there in black and white, Mr. Murdoch. 18 00:06:01,424 --> 00:06:03,170 Day and date. 19 00:06:03,900 --> 00:06:07,257 We make our books like we make our beds, all neat and tidy. 20 00:06:07,333 --> 00:06:09,044 I'll take care of it when I get back. 21 00:06:09,222 --> 00:06:12,188 See that you do. Only thing makes you a guest in this joint... 22 00:06:12,189 --> 00:06:14,482 ...pal, is cash on the barrelhead. 23 00:06:37,790 --> 00:06:40,500 House rules. 3 weeks is 3 weeks. 24 00:06:40,750 --> 00:06:43,149 No days off for good behavior. 25 00:07:05,108 --> 00:07:08,785 Mr. Murdoch, yes, where is he? 26 00:07:09,038 --> 00:07:12,483 He just left not 5 minutes ago. 27 00:07:15,768 --> 00:07:17,649 Sleep now. 28 00:07:20,029 --> 00:07:23,562 When marimba rhythms start to play 29 00:07:23,916 --> 00:07:26,013 Dance with me 30 00:07:26,278 --> 00:07:28,643 Make me sway 31 00:07:29,103 --> 00:07:32,981 Like a lazy ocean hugs the shore 32 00:07:33,257 --> 00:07:37,930 Hold me close Sway me more 33 00:07:38,645 --> 00:07:42,540 Like a flower bending in the breeze 34 00:07:42,934 --> 00:07:44,899 Bend with me 35 00:07:45,377 --> 00:07:47,675 Sway with ease 36 00:07:47,943 --> 00:07:51,699 When we dance you have a way with me 37 00:07:52,285 --> 00:07:56,772 Stay with me Sway with me 38 00:07:57,877 --> 00:07:59,093 Hey, sweetie! 39 00:07:59,816 --> 00:08:01,800 He said he was your husband's doctor. 40 00:08:01,991 --> 00:08:03,830 He wanted to speak with you. 41 00:08:23,846 --> 00:08:25,211 Excuse me. 42 00:08:26,863 --> 00:08:28,661 - Dr. Sh-- - Schreber. 43 00:08:28,691 --> 00:08:32,900 Please, won't you come in? You must be Emma Murdoch. 44 00:08:33,800 --> 00:08:37,296 Thank you for coming to see me on such short notice. 45 00:08:39,158 --> 00:08:40,412 What is this? 46 00:08:41,507 --> 00:08:45,702 A rather crude experiment... designed to further my studies. 47 00:08:45,768 --> 00:08:46,805 I don't understand. 48 00:08:46,806 --> 00:08:52,008 You say you're my husband's doctor, but he never mentioned you to me. 49 00:08:52,222 --> 00:08:55,872 The truth is, Mrs. Murdoch... John has been coming to see me for quite some time. 50 00:08:56,144 --> 00:08:59,634 He had been grappling with feelings of betrayal... 51 00:08:59,689 --> 00:09:02,405 ...stemming from your marital difficulties. 52 00:09:03,019 --> 00:09:05,155 - John told you what happened? - Yes. 53 00:09:06,245 --> 00:09:08,327 When was the last time that you saw him? 54 00:09:08,631 --> 00:09:09,915 3 weeks ago. 55 00:09:10,125 --> 00:09:13,783 He packed a suitcase. He was very angry at me. 56 00:09:13,891 --> 00:09:16,863 I understand how difficult this must be for you. 57 00:09:17,099 --> 00:09:21,178 But for John's sake, I would like you to think of me as your friend, Emma. 58 00:09:21,644 --> 00:09:24,535 It appears that John has suffered a psychotic break. 59 00:09:24,824 --> 00:09:26,829 Complete memory loss. 60 00:09:27,934 --> 00:09:31,336 He may be delusional. Even violent. 61 00:09:31,910 --> 00:09:32,878 Emma... 62 00:09:34,105 --> 00:09:37,376 ...if he were to contact you, and I suspect he will... 63 00:09:37,857 --> 00:09:40,690 ...you must call me immediately. Do you understand? 64 00:09:40,820 --> 00:09:44,086 It is imperative that I be the first one to reach him. 65 00:09:44,894 --> 00:09:48,382 Wherever your husband is, he is searching... 66 00:09:50,063 --> 00:09:51,606 ...for himself. 67 00:10:02,375 --> 00:10:04,133 Good evening, Mr. Murdoch. 68 00:10:04,567 --> 00:10:06,695 It is Mr. Murdoch, isn't it? 69 00:10:07,269 --> 00:10:10,828 Mr. -was it "J"-something-Murdoch? 70 00:10:14,096 --> 00:10:15,191 J. Murdoch. 71 00:10:15,500 --> 00:10:18,402 What's your name? Justin? Jerry? 72 00:10:19,279 --> 00:10:20,155 No. 73 00:10:22,528 --> 00:10:24,504 My name's Jason Murdoch. John Murdoch. 74 00:10:24,744 --> 00:10:26,012 Jake Murdoch. How's it going? 75 00:10:26,167 --> 00:10:27,099 Hi. Jack Murdoch. 76 00:10:30,513 --> 00:10:31,531 Hi. 77 00:11:11,257 --> 00:11:12,299 Bumstead. 78 00:11:14,527 --> 00:11:17,449 I told the guy, "Cash on the barrelhead." 79 00:11:17,560 --> 00:11:20,951 I said, "Listen, 3 weeks is 3 weeks." 80 00:11:21,083 --> 00:11:22,270 Where's our lucky winner? 81 00:11:22,501 --> 00:11:24,873 Upstairs, sir, room 614. 82 00:11:25,711 --> 00:11:27,184 Another call girl. 83 00:11:28,315 --> 00:11:30,303 "J. Murdoch." 84 00:11:31,747 --> 00:11:34,785 - Evening, Husselbeck. - Inspector Bumstead. 85 00:11:35,124 --> 00:11:36,564 Your lace is untied. 86 00:11:37,623 --> 00:11:38,688 Sir. 87 00:11:49,882 --> 00:11:51,557 Am I glad you're here, sir. 88 00:11:51,757 --> 00:11:54,236 They say Detective Walenski's got the heebie-jeebies. 89 00:11:54,342 --> 00:11:56,357 Just take what they give me, Husselbeck. 90 00:12:05,311 --> 00:12:07,634 Wow. Looks like somebody woke up on the wrong side of the bed. 91 00:12:50,870 --> 00:12:52,516 - Hello. - Oh, it's you. 92 00:12:53,460 --> 00:12:56,026 - You left your wallet here, buddy. - When did I do that? 93 00:12:56,198 --> 00:12:57,160 When you was last here. 94 00:12:57,420 --> 00:13:00,024 - When was that? - When you left your wallet. 95 00:13:00,336 --> 00:13:01,937 You expect me to remember? 96 00:13:05,177 --> 00:13:08,614 Hello. Excuse me. 97 00:13:09,208 --> 00:13:10,259 No, no, seriously. 98 00:13:14,062 --> 00:13:15,529 Alleged? 99 00:13:29,492 --> 00:13:31,427 - Where you headed, chief? - Home. 100 00:13:31,682 --> 00:13:32,808 And where's home? 101 00:13:32,978 --> 00:13:35,130 Haven't you mugs got anything better to do? 102 00:13:35,811 --> 00:13:37,901 Well, I'm just trying to do my job, May. 103 00:13:38,073 --> 00:13:39,956 There's a killer out there in case you hadn't noticed. 104 00:13:40,186 --> 00:13:42,732 Maybe you should be out looking for him instead of cooling your heels, huh? 105 00:13:45,978 --> 00:13:47,755 Go on, get out of here. 106 00:13:56,325 --> 00:13:57,137 Come on. 107 00:13:58,197 --> 00:14:00,572 Round and round she goes. 108 00:14:03,108 --> 00:14:07,164 Where she stops? Nobody knows. 109 00:14:10,132 --> 00:14:13,100 What's that make so far, Husselbeck? 6 hookers in all? 110 00:14:13,170 --> 00:14:14,401 I believe so, sir. 111 00:14:15,094 --> 00:14:17,051 Give the man an "A" for effort. 112 00:14:17,263 --> 00:14:21,478 You'd think these stiffs would have the good grace to expire at a good time of night. 113 00:14:22,688 --> 00:14:24,982 Hey, too bad about Walenski, huh? 114 00:14:28,407 --> 00:14:30,007 I guess he'd seen enough. 115 00:14:37,299 --> 00:14:38,199 So, Husselbeck... 116 00:14:39,445 --> 00:14:45,771 ...what kind of killer do you think stops to save a dying fish? 117 00:14:46,144 --> 00:14:47,094 You've got me, sir. 118 00:14:47,095 --> 00:14:49,049 Bumstead, what took you? 119 00:14:49,375 --> 00:14:52,388 This killer's been running circles around us thanks to Walenski. 120 00:14:52,389 --> 00:14:54,146 With all due respect, Chief Inspector... 121 00:14:54,147 --> 00:14:56,878 I've known Eddie a long time. He's a good cop. 122 00:14:57,536 --> 00:15:01,544 Whatever kind of cop Walenski once was, he let drift a long time ago. 123 00:15:01,754 --> 00:15:03,006 Let me talk to Bumstead! 124 00:15:04,819 --> 00:15:05,782 Hold on! 125 00:15:06,377 --> 00:15:07,408 Frank, Frank! 126 00:15:10,185 --> 00:15:12,166 - Get his arm! - They're watching us! 127 00:15:12,238 --> 00:15:14,422 - On your feet. - There's no way out! 128 00:15:16,302 --> 00:15:17,882 God, can't you see?! 129 00:15:21,427 --> 00:15:22,555 Let me go, let me go! 130 00:15:22,805 --> 00:15:23,848 I'm not gonna hurt you. I'm not-- 131 00:15:25,091 --> 00:15:27,305 - What was that? - Walenski. 132 00:15:35,901 --> 00:15:38,573 I'm being punished for my sins, right? 133 00:15:39,134 --> 00:15:41,417 What did I ever do to inherit this? 134 00:15:41,437 --> 00:15:42,551 Where do you begin? 135 00:15:43,135 --> 00:15:47,569 Well, everything Detective Walenski committed to paper should be here, so-- 136 00:15:47,609 --> 00:15:50,505 The only thing that should be committed is Walenski. 137 00:15:52,795 --> 00:15:54,821 Nothing like a little healthy paranoia. 138 00:15:58,397 --> 00:16:00,863 Sir, we just got the fingerprint results in. 139 00:16:04,944 --> 00:16:06,753 What is this, some kind of joke? 140 00:16:10,930 --> 00:16:12,520 Don't throw anything away. 141 00:16:18,327 --> 00:16:19,668 Inspector Bumstead. 142 00:16:21,797 --> 00:16:24,675 I came here to file a missing persons report for my husband. 143 00:16:25,211 --> 00:16:26,915 Take it to the front desk. 144 00:16:27,486 --> 00:16:29,042 They told me to come see you. 145 00:16:31,160 --> 00:16:33,027 His name's John Murdoch. 146 00:16:34,326 --> 00:16:37,399 Mrs. Murdoch, why didn't you report this before? 147 00:16:37,400 --> 00:16:42,056 I mean, if your husband has been missing as long as you say... 148 00:16:42,664 --> 00:16:44,527 I thought he'd simply walked out on me. 149 00:16:46,105 --> 00:16:49,804 Then a... doctor contacted me this evening. 150 00:16:50,479 --> 00:16:53,253 - How long have you been married? - Nearly four years. 151 00:16:54,580 --> 00:16:55,580 Why do you ask? 152 00:16:56,054 --> 00:16:58,945 Because you seem uncomfortable with your ring. 153 00:16:59,230 --> 00:17:02,980 As if you were... unaccustomed to wearing it. 154 00:17:03,352 --> 00:17:04,608 No, I never take it off. 155 00:17:10,890 --> 00:17:14,447 Do these names mean anything to you? 156 00:17:20,366 --> 00:17:22,449 No. Who are these women? 157 00:17:23,829 --> 00:17:27,668 Why are you looking for my husband? Are you going to accuse him of something? 158 00:17:27,703 --> 00:17:29,843 Maybe. Maybe murder. 159 00:17:30,160 --> 00:17:31,010 Whose murder? 160 00:17:32,614 --> 00:17:36,101 - Which one? - All of them. 161 00:17:36,976 --> 00:17:40,531 Mrs. Murdoch, I am sorry, I'm sorry. I didn't mean to alarm you. 162 00:17:40,532 --> 00:17:43,118 I'm so sorry that I came. Just both made a mistake. 163 00:17:43,119 --> 00:17:44,636 Mrs. Murdoch, if you please. 164 00:17:44,637 --> 00:17:47,002 If you'll just give me half a second to explain-- 165 00:17:50,259 --> 00:17:51,352 I'll be right out. 166 00:18:15,627 --> 00:18:16,847 Have we met before? 167 00:18:18,274 --> 00:18:21,483 If we did... I hope you're still breathing. 168 00:18:21,714 --> 00:18:23,176 What's your name, honey? 169 00:18:24,937 --> 00:18:25,880 John. 170 00:18:26,889 --> 00:18:28,652 Well, that's an appropriate name. 171 00:18:29,713 --> 00:18:30,702 Yeah. 172 00:18:36,539 --> 00:18:38,195 I was just thinking. 173 00:18:42,064 --> 00:18:43,554 What you do... 174 00:18:44,897 --> 00:18:47,756 ...seems kind of dangerous... 175 00:18:48,485 --> 00:18:49,867 ...right now. 176 00:18:50,457 --> 00:18:52,106 I mean, how do you know I'm not the killer? 177 00:18:52,147 --> 00:18:55,264 You don't seem like the killer type. Why? 178 00:18:56,572 --> 00:18:58,730 You feeling any urges I should know about? 179 00:19:20,379 --> 00:19:21,799 Aw, shoot. 180 00:20:20,849 --> 00:20:24,557 So it seems you've discovered your unpleasant nature. 181 00:20:27,826 --> 00:20:31,920 - Who are you? - We might ask the same question, yes? 182 00:20:32,628 --> 00:20:34,897 Sleep now. 183 00:21:01,940 --> 00:21:02,800 He can tune. 184 00:21:55,881 --> 00:21:59,237 What is to be done? This man is dangerous. 185 00:21:59,268 --> 00:22:01,186 It is said he is able to tune. 186 00:22:01,306 --> 00:22:02,470 Impossible. 187 00:22:02,710 --> 00:22:05,148 We have seen it with our own eyes. 188 00:22:05,574 --> 00:22:07,754 On occasion the imprinting does not take. 189 00:22:07,973 --> 00:22:10,644 They behave erratically when they awaken. 190 00:22:10,906 --> 00:22:14,523 We find them wandering like lost children. 191 00:22:14,596 --> 00:22:16,765 But this one was different, yes? 192 00:22:16,901 --> 00:22:18,423 What has the doctor to say about this? 193 00:22:18,608 --> 00:22:20,335 He has failed to report in. 194 00:22:20,591 --> 00:22:23,629 - And Mr. Quick? - No more Mr. Quick. 195 00:22:23,799 --> 00:22:26,656 Mr. Quick, dead, yes. 196 00:22:29,678 --> 00:22:32,352 Poor, poor Mr. Quick. 197 00:22:32,613 --> 00:22:35,221 Mr. Book, does he know? 198 00:22:36,688 --> 00:22:38,402 Should we not know, Mr. Hand? 199 00:22:39,391 --> 00:22:42,234 We had hoped to learn more before sharing with you. 200 00:22:42,444 --> 00:22:45,244 We can know nothing until we possess him. 201 00:22:46,158 --> 00:22:48,848 Mr. Night, you will take the East. 202 00:22:49,050 --> 00:22:53,608 Mr. Face, you the West. Mr. Glove, the South. 203 00:22:53,778 --> 00:22:55,970 Mr. Shade, the North. 204 00:22:57,753 --> 00:23:00,131 We must have this man. 205 00:23:14,249 --> 00:23:19,013 Do you really think my husband could be capable of committing those murders? 206 00:23:19,651 --> 00:23:20,836 Do you? 207 00:23:22,794 --> 00:23:25,194 Let's hope, for both our sakes, that I'm wrong. 208 00:23:54,449 --> 00:23:55,483 John. 209 00:24:10,525 --> 00:24:12,082 I've been so worried about you. 210 00:24:15,754 --> 00:24:17,306 Are you punishing me? 211 00:24:17,939 --> 00:24:20,365 You know, if disappearing is your way of punishing me... 212 00:24:20,385 --> 00:24:23,118 ...I don't appreciate it. - I don't know what you're talking about. 213 00:24:26,365 --> 00:24:28,292 I found these keys in my pocket... 214 00:24:29,140 --> 00:24:30,556 ...so I assume I live here. 215 00:24:32,127 --> 00:24:34,846 - You supposed to be my wife? - Supposed to be? 216 00:24:35,725 --> 00:24:36,789 John. 217 00:24:38,063 --> 00:24:39,215 You really... 218 00:24:39,996 --> 00:24:42,101 ...don't know who I am, do you? 219 00:24:43,206 --> 00:24:45,899 Your doctor called me. He was worried that this might happen. 220 00:24:45,919 --> 00:24:48,443 - My doctor? - Yeah. He... 221 00:24:50,216 --> 00:24:51,773 ...he gave me his card. 222 00:24:52,277 --> 00:24:54,125 He's desperate to find you. 223 00:24:55,632 --> 00:24:57,009 Schreber. 224 00:25:01,666 --> 00:25:03,732 I feel like I'm living out someone else's nightmare. 225 00:25:03,762 --> 00:25:06,267 What happened to me? Why was I seeing a doctor? 226 00:25:07,135 --> 00:25:08,840 I had an affair. 227 00:25:10,519 --> 00:25:12,281 You were angry at me. 228 00:25:15,170 --> 00:25:17,122 The police are looking for you. 229 00:25:17,332 --> 00:25:19,199 I know. I saw the papers. 230 00:25:19,408 --> 00:25:22,232 "Killer stalks city streetwalkers." 231 00:25:25,690 --> 00:25:28,238 I was with one of those women... 232 00:25:29,176 --> 00:25:31,048 ...before I came here tonight. 233 00:25:31,506 --> 00:25:32,804 I don't understand. 234 00:25:33,518 --> 00:25:34,855 I met her outside an Automat. 235 00:25:35,750 --> 00:25:38,087 I guess I wanted to test myself. 236 00:25:39,330 --> 00:25:42,536 I wanted to know if I had it in me to do those things. 237 00:25:43,031 --> 00:25:45,462 Maybe I have lost my mind, but whoever I am... 238 00:25:45,463 --> 00:25:47,455 ...I'm still me and I'm not a killer. 239 00:25:53,575 --> 00:25:55,082 I believe you. 240 00:25:56,865 --> 00:25:58,137 You do? 241 00:26:02,353 --> 00:26:03,179 What? 242 00:26:03,319 --> 00:26:05,699 The car outside, the one you arrived in. 243 00:26:06,147 --> 00:26:08,606 It's a cop. He dropped me off here. 244 00:26:10,579 --> 00:26:12,427 I didn't know he was still here. 245 00:26:13,298 --> 00:26:14,149 John. 246 00:26:15,584 --> 00:26:17,021 Hold it right there, mister! 247 00:26:19,481 --> 00:26:21,570 Wait. You have the wrong man. 248 00:26:21,738 --> 00:26:24,317 - Stand aside, will you, please? - I didn't kill anyone. 249 00:26:24,346 --> 00:26:27,743 Right now what you are is a suspect. Turn yourself in. 250 00:26:28,563 --> 00:26:30,161 I'll listen to whatever you have to say. 251 00:26:30,162 --> 00:26:31,770 You're not gonna believe what I have to say. 252 00:26:32,810 --> 00:26:34,027 Try me. 253 00:26:34,517 --> 00:26:36,010 There's someone after me. 254 00:26:36,501 --> 00:26:39,429 There's this group of men. They want me dead. 255 00:26:39,993 --> 00:26:42,211 And I don't even know if-- They're not even-- 256 00:26:43,074 --> 00:26:45,128 Yeah, who's gonna listen to a madman? 257 00:26:45,333 --> 00:26:46,492 Stand aside, Mrs. Murdoch. 258 00:26:46,868 --> 00:26:47,658 Run! 259 00:26:52,110 --> 00:26:54,195 No one ever listens to me. 260 00:27:00,155 --> 00:27:01,361 Murdoch, stop! 261 00:27:06,371 --> 00:27:07,398 Murdoch! 262 00:27:44,172 --> 00:27:46,494 - How much further? - We're almost there, buddy. 263 00:27:50,202 --> 00:27:52,291 Hey, you happen to know the way to Shell Beach? 264 00:27:52,561 --> 00:27:55,637 You're kidding. Me and the missus spent our honeymoon there. 265 00:27:55,807 --> 00:27:58,317 All you gotta do is take Main Street west to-- 266 00:28:00,979 --> 00:28:02,483 Or is it the cross-- 267 00:28:03,224 --> 00:28:06,575 You know, that's funny. I can't seem to remember... 268 00:28:06,675 --> 00:28:08,787 ...if it's Main Street west or the cross-town. 269 00:28:13,428 --> 00:28:16,771 I'm sorry, Inspector, I cannot be of more assistance... 270 00:28:16,918 --> 00:28:18,906 ...but I am running late for an appointment. 271 00:28:18,911 --> 00:28:21,055 Well, I appreciate your taking the time. 272 00:28:29,631 --> 00:28:31,869 There's just one thing that puzzles me. 273 00:28:31,946 --> 00:28:36,390 I've met quite a few murderers in the course of my work. 274 00:28:36,721 --> 00:28:39,138 Murdoch doesn't strike me as one. 275 00:28:39,434 --> 00:28:42,719 Perhaps you are not accustomed to digging deep enough. 276 00:28:43,118 --> 00:28:45,487 Well, I do know when someone is lying to me, Doctor. 277 00:28:45,687 --> 00:28:48,149 Forgive me, Inspector, but you are not a clinician. 278 00:28:48,606 --> 00:28:51,907 Judging personalities happens to be my business. 279 00:28:52,127 --> 00:28:54,085 Well, maybe you could give me a few pointers. 280 00:28:54,195 --> 00:28:55,275 Certainly. 281 00:28:55,855 --> 00:28:57,738 Let's take you, for instance. 282 00:28:58,153 --> 00:29:03,612 You are a fastidious man, driven. Consumed by details. 283 00:29:04,342 --> 00:29:06,091 I would say your life is... 284 00:29:07,475 --> 00:29:11,698 ...rather lonely. Good evening, Inspector. I really must be going. 285 00:29:53,291 --> 00:29:57,276 Closing time. The pool is now closed. 286 00:30:04,352 --> 00:30:06,075 Dr. Schreber. 287 00:30:07,042 --> 00:30:11,793 Most unfortunate it is that we were forced to seek you out here. 288 00:30:12,634 --> 00:30:17,286 You know how uncomfortable we find all this... moisture. 289 00:30:17,626 --> 00:30:20,949 - I'm sorry. I-- - Failed to report in, yes. 290 00:30:21,079 --> 00:30:23,618 I was frightened. I have a weak heart, you know. 291 00:30:23,768 --> 00:30:27,521 Your weakness is not, we think, an affair of the heart. 292 00:30:27,522 --> 00:30:30,223 We found this in his hotel room. 293 00:30:30,345 --> 00:30:34,075 Must we reproduce Mr. Murdoch's memories again? 294 00:30:34,255 --> 00:30:35,178 I tried to imprint him... 295 00:30:35,179 --> 00:30:37,405 ...but he woke up, he knocked the syringe right out of my hand. 296 00:30:37,406 --> 00:30:39,495 I tried to stop him but he was too fast. 297 00:30:39,671 --> 00:30:40,812 He has no memories, then? 298 00:30:40,922 --> 00:30:44,215 Only fragments. The procedure, it was interrupted. 299 00:30:44,355 --> 00:30:47,299 I guess it's only a matter of rounding him up. 300 00:30:48,142 --> 00:30:49,212 You have had strays before, right? 301 00:30:49,554 --> 00:30:53,745 This is no stray, Doctor. This one can tune. 302 00:30:53,765 --> 00:30:56,501 But that's impossible. I thought only you had that ability. 303 00:30:56,506 --> 00:31:00,758 You will process another template of the subject's memories, yes? 304 00:31:00,999 --> 00:31:02,647 Of course. I'll imprint him again. 305 00:31:02,777 --> 00:31:07,341 No. We require them for a quite different purpose. 306 00:31:08,296 --> 00:31:10,418 It's almost midnight, Dr. Schreber. 307 00:31:10,568 --> 00:31:12,853 We'll talk again after tonight's tuning, but... 308 00:31:13,331 --> 00:31:15,266 ...no more delays, yes? 309 00:31:15,526 --> 00:31:20,127 No more inconsistencies in your behavior. 310 00:31:27,729 --> 00:31:29,919 You appear quite frail, Doctor. 311 00:31:31,106 --> 00:31:34,103 Perhaps some exercise would do you good. 312 00:31:48,496 --> 00:31:50,158 - Come in. - Kate. 313 00:31:54,750 --> 00:31:56,579 - How is he? - The same. 314 00:31:57,492 --> 00:32:00,301 Walenski? It's a joke! 343 00:34:35,772 --> 00:34:37,933 Tonight's requirements are... 344 00:34:38,032 --> 00:34:42,783 ...12 family photo albums, 9 personal diaries... 345 00:34:43,078 --> 00:34:47,855 ...17 love letters, assorted childhood photographs... 346 00:34:47,963 --> 00:34:52,116 ...26 wallets, ID's and social security cards. 347 00:34:52,126 --> 00:34:54,106 These do bring back memories. 348 00:34:56,447 --> 00:34:58,687 This one is still warm. 349 00:34:59,256 --> 00:35:00,522 What is it? 350 00:35:00,832 --> 00:35:03,783 The recollections of a great lover? 351 00:35:04,018 --> 00:35:06,498 A catalog of conquests? 352 00:35:07,066 --> 00:35:08,428 We will soon find out. 353 00:35:09,737 --> 00:35:14,170 You wouldn't appreciate that, would you, Mr. Whatever your name is? 354 00:35:14,609 --> 00:35:18,769 Not the sort of conquests you would ever understand. 355 00:35:19,683 --> 00:35:20,856 Let's see. 356 00:35:22,273 --> 00:35:24,864 A touch of unhappy childhood. 357 00:35:30,615 --> 00:35:33,336 A dash of teenage rebellion. 358 00:35:35,096 --> 00:35:37,228 And last, but not least... 359 00:35:37,923 --> 00:35:40,494 ...a tragic death in the family. 360 00:35:40,524 --> 00:35:42,004 Doctor. 361 00:35:43,604 --> 00:35:45,162 Mr. Book. 362 00:35:52,026 --> 00:35:55,843 Why does Murdoch not sleep during the tuning as the others do? 363 00:35:55,880 --> 00:36:00,105 I don't know. Yes? 425 00:46:34,725 --> 00:46:35,804 Yes. 426 00:46:51,108 --> 00:46:56,973 They say that you're a run-around lover 427 00:46:58,779 --> 00:47:01,031 Though you say 428 00:47:02,379 --> 00:47:05,506 It isn't so 429 00:47:09,750 --> 00:47:15,518 But if you put me down for another 430 00:47:17,898 --> 00:47:24,410 I'll know Believe me, I'll know 431 00:47:25,906 --> 00:47:34,118 'Cause the night has a thousand eyes 432 00:47:34,828 --> 00:47:38,694 And a thousand eyes 433 00:47:39,032 --> 00:47:42,067 Can't tell, but see 434 00:47:44,718 --> 00:47:51,122 If you are true to me 435 00:47:52,593 --> 00:48:02,365 So remember When you tell those little white lies 436 00:48:02,548 --> 00:48:10,475 That the night has a thousand eyes 437 00:48:15,953 --> 00:48:20,517 A thousand eyes 438 00:48:27,104 --> 00:48:30,734 Tonight's experiment shall be conducted in the following locations. 439 00:48:30,874 --> 00:48:35,172 The first subject shall be imprinted here on Avenue M. 440 00:48:35,173 --> 00:48:37,781 Mr. Book. She saw what happened here. 602 01:03:04,911 --> 01:03:06,858 Are you ready to go home, Mrs. Murdoch? 603 01:03:07,990 --> 01:03:10,843 The inspector is gonna take me. Thanks. 604 01:03:35,331 --> 01:03:36,673 It's beautiful. 605 01:03:39,208 --> 01:03:41,830 It was a gift from my mother. 606 01:03:42,716 --> 01:03:44,037 She died recently. 607 01:03:45,012 --> 01:03:47,597 I keep it with me to remind me of her. 608 01:03:49,502 --> 01:03:50,856 I'm sorry. 609 01:03:54,137 --> 01:03:55,897 It's a funny thing, though. 610 01:03:56,952 --> 01:03:58,770 I can't remember when she gave it to me. 611 01:04:01,297 --> 01:04:04,114 How do you think I could forget a thing like that? 612 01:04:06,349 --> 01:04:10,595 Do you think about the past much, Mrs. Murdoch? 613 01:04:12,709 --> 01:04:15,112 What's happening, Inspector? 614 01:04:15,865 --> 01:04:18,221 I'm not sure I know anymore. 615 01:04:21,731 --> 01:04:23,947 I left your old room like it was. 616 01:04:24,624 --> 01:04:26,399 You can sleep here tonight, huh? 617 01:04:26,812 --> 01:04:28,603 Glad to have you back, Johnny... 618 01:04:29,068 --> 01:04:31,759 ...even if it is for just a night. - Karl. 619 01:04:32,979 --> 01:04:34,187 Is that the right time? 620 01:04:34,192 --> 01:04:38,004 Why, sure. That clock's kept perfect time since I bought it. 621 01:04:38,214 --> 01:04:39,618 A.m. or p.m.? 622 01:04:41,120 --> 01:04:42,552 What do you think, Johnny? 623 01:04:42,672 --> 01:04:44,577 I don't understand. How can it be night already? 624 01:04:44,578 --> 01:04:46,312 What happened to the day? How'd I miss it? 625 01:04:46,432 --> 01:04:49,066 You're tired. Anything's possible. 626 01:04:49,125 --> 01:04:50,346 Look... 627 01:04:50,507 --> 01:04:54,376 ...get some sleep. We'll straighten all this out tomorrow. 628 01:05:20,289 --> 01:05:23,067 "Guide to Shell Beach by Johnny Murdoch." 629 01:05:26,102 --> 01:05:27,620 Oh, come on. 630 01:05:46,279 --> 01:05:47,642 - Hello? - Emma... 631 01:05:47,796 --> 01:05:48,789 ...he's here. 632 01:05:48,908 --> 01:05:51,478 - He's acting mighty peculiar. - I know. 633 01:05:51,603 --> 01:05:52,981 He's not himself. 634 01:05:53,199 --> 01:05:54,618 Keep him there, and... 635 01:05:54,808 --> 01:05:56,075 ...I'll be right over. - I'll try. 636 01:05:56,231 --> 01:05:57,540 Thanks, Karl. Bye. 637 01:06:00,179 --> 01:06:01,032 Johnny. 638 01:06:01,172 --> 01:06:03,015 I can't promise anything, Mrs. Murdoch. 639 01:06:03,135 --> 01:06:04,547 We just have to play it as it comes. 640 01:06:04,867 --> 01:06:07,849 Johnny, we just wanted to help. 641 01:06:14,761 --> 01:06:16,125 Karl. 642 01:06:16,832 --> 01:06:18,296 Uncle Karl. 643 01:06:18,406 --> 01:06:21,486 Johnny, if you're in some kind of trouble, well, maybe we could do something. 644 01:06:23,266 --> 01:06:25,939 Haven't seen you in so long. 645 01:06:26,212 --> 01:06:27,769 Yes. 646 01:07:40,659 --> 01:07:45,410 Mr. Murdoch... you've been the cause of much distress. 647 01:07:49,802 --> 01:07:52,446 - Start talking. - There's no need for this. 648 01:07:52,551 --> 01:07:53,853 There's no escape. 649 01:07:53,953 --> 01:07:55,918 The city's ours. We made it. 650 01:07:56,038 --> 01:07:57,403 What are you talking about? 651 01:07:57,433 --> 01:08:00,637 We fashioned this city on stolen memories... 652 01:08:00,659 --> 01:08:04,480 ...different eras, different pasts all rolled into one. 653 01:08:04,970 --> 01:08:08,580 Each night, we revise it, refine it in order to learn. 654 01:08:08,701 --> 01:08:09,788 Learn what? 655 01:08:10,118 --> 01:08:13,782 About you, Mr. Murdoch. You and your fellow inhabitants... 656 01:08:13,929 --> 01:08:15,654 ...what makes you human. 657 01:08:16,215 --> 01:08:19,518 - Why?! - We need to be like you. 658 01:08:20,129 --> 01:08:22,560 I understand you now, Mr. Murdoch. 659 01:08:22,561 --> 01:08:26,105 I remember that which you do not... what you've been missing. 660 01:08:26,285 --> 01:08:27,792 The ocean, yes... 661 01:08:28,898 --> 01:08:31,517 ...running along the waves as a child... 662 01:08:31,707 --> 01:08:36,506 ...meeting Emma at the river... That first kiss that followed. 663 01:08:37,196 --> 01:08:40,125 - What are you? - You've seen what we are. 664 01:08:40,299 --> 01:08:42,966 We use your dead as vessels. 665 01:10:52,781 --> 01:10:53,640 Get in! 666 01:11:09,095 --> 01:11:11,720 What about her? Ring any bells? 667 01:11:11,840 --> 01:11:13,098 She was alive when I left her. 668 01:11:13,208 --> 01:11:16,212 - What about this? - This is nothing. This is-- 669 01:11:16,262 --> 01:11:18,507 It must mean something, all those pictures. 670 01:11:18,747 --> 01:11:19,313 What pictures? 671 01:11:20,876 --> 01:11:21,894 I don't understand this. 672 01:11:21,994 --> 01:11:24,723 Stop playing games with me, Murdoch! Stop telling me lies! 673 01:11:24,853 --> 01:11:28,632 - I am not telling you lies! - Help me out here. Make me understand. 674 01:11:28,633 --> 01:11:30,849 I have this jigsaw puzzle in front of my face... 675 01:11:30,850 --> 01:11:33,716 ...and every time I try to rearrange the pieces, it still doesn't make any sense. 676 01:11:33,717 --> 01:11:37,227 You think it makes sense to me? I'm as much in the dark here as you are. 677 01:11:38,169 --> 01:11:39,528 You let me ask you a question? 678 01:11:40,729 --> 01:11:42,104 You heard of a place called Shell Beach? 679 01:11:42,214 --> 01:11:43,932 - Sure. - You know how to get there? 680 01:11:44,450 --> 01:11:45,968 - Yeah. - You tell me? 681 01:11:47,523 --> 01:11:50,198 All right. You just-- You go to the... 682 01:11:51,206 --> 01:11:53,732 - Where? Where do you go? - Just give me a second, will ya? 683 01:11:56,308 --> 01:11:58,119 You can't remember, can you? 684 01:12:00,669 --> 01:12:01,891 You think that's kind of odd? 685 01:12:04,119 --> 01:12:06,392 Wait. I got a better one for you. 686 01:12:06,538 --> 01:12:07,763 When was the last time... 687 01:12:07,853 --> 01:12:10,223 ...you remember doing something during the day? 688 01:12:10,766 --> 01:12:13,855 - What do you mean? - I just mean... during the day. 689 01:12:14,934 --> 01:12:15,981 Daylight. 690 01:12:16,051 --> 01:12:17,723 When was the last time you remember seeing it? 691 01:12:17,924 --> 01:12:21,557 And I'm not talking about some distant, half-forgotten childhood memory. 692 01:12:21,558 --> 01:12:24,544 I mean like yesterday? Last week? When? 693 01:12:25,142 --> 01:12:26,978 Can you come up with a single memory? 694 01:12:28,621 --> 01:12:29,925 You can't, can you? 695 01:12:30,115 --> 01:12:32,350 You know something? I don't think the sun even... 696 01:12:32,979 --> 01:12:35,935 ...exists... in this place. 697 01:12:36,145 --> 01:12:40,188 'Cause I've been up for hours and hours and hours and the night never ends here. 698 01:12:41,043 --> 01:12:43,438 - That is crazy. - You're damn right this is crazy. 699 01:12:43,478 --> 01:12:46,145 Listen to me, Bumstead. It's not just me. 700 01:12:46,635 --> 01:12:47,935 It's all of us. 701 01:12:48,292 --> 01:12:49,855 They're doing something to all of us. 702 01:12:49,856 --> 01:12:52,608 - Shut up, I've heard enough. - Please listen. 703 01:12:52,728 --> 01:12:54,246 - Shut up, will ya! Shut up! - Listen to me. 704 01:13:04,836 --> 01:13:07,736 There has to be an explanation for this somewhere. 705 01:13:15,798 --> 01:13:17,380 Explain this. 706 01:13:37,793 --> 01:13:40,108 John, I'm so sorry. 707 01:13:41,163 --> 01:13:44,165 I never meant to hurt you, John, and I did it, and I don't know why I did. 708 01:13:44,269 --> 01:13:48,918 - I wish I could take it all back. - No. Emma... You didn't do it. 709 01:13:49,141 --> 01:13:53,170 This... affair of yours, whatever it is the thing you're supposed to have done... 710 01:13:53,175 --> 01:13:55,254 ...you didn't do it. I don't believe it ever happened. 711 01:13:55,255 --> 01:13:58,744 - What do you mean? - I know this is gonna sound crazy... 712 01:13:58,932 --> 01:14:01,927 ...but what if we never knew each other before now? 713 01:14:02,227 --> 01:14:04,526 What if the first time we ever met... 714 01:14:04,886 --> 01:14:08,330 ...was last night in your-- in our apartment... 715 01:14:08,597 --> 01:14:10,682 ...and everything you remember... 716 01:14:11,067 --> 01:14:14,216 ...and everything that I'm supposed to remember never really happened? 717 01:14:14,396 --> 01:14:16,781 Someone just wants us to think it did. 718 01:14:21,980 --> 01:14:24,035 You know, back in the apartment... 719 01:14:24,960 --> 01:14:28,002 ...I suddenly felt like I didn't know you at all. 720 01:14:29,338 --> 01:14:31,921 It was as if you were a stranger. 721 01:14:34,059 --> 01:14:35,840 But how can that be true? 722 01:14:36,395 --> 01:14:39,469 I so vividly remember meeting you. 723 01:14:40,536 --> 01:14:43,335 I remember falling in love with you. 724 01:14:44,466 --> 01:14:46,507 I remember losing you. 725 01:14:46,855 --> 01:14:47,853 Time's up. 726 01:14:48,834 --> 01:14:50,370 No, wait, wait. 727 01:14:50,799 --> 01:14:52,414 Please, just... 728 01:14:52,677 --> 01:14:53,914 ...just one more minute. 729 01:15:00,256 --> 01:15:02,243 I love you, John. 730 01:15:05,267 --> 01:15:07,829 You can't fake something like that. 731 01:15:09,057 --> 01:15:10,558 No, you can't. 732 01:15:39,802 --> 01:15:42,400 Inspector? Sir? 733 01:15:43,722 --> 01:15:46,475 Detective Walenski killed himself last night. 734 01:15:48,881 --> 01:15:50,230 I... kind of thought you should know. 735 01:15:52,851 --> 01:15:56,405 Oh, and... the chief wanted to see you. 736 01:15:56,678 --> 01:15:57,952 Sir... 737 01:16:04,189 --> 01:16:05,963 I knew you'd track the killer down, sir. 738 01:16:18,584 --> 01:16:19,636 Sir... 739 01:16:21,420 --> 01:16:22,633 ...shoelace. 740 01:16:35,891 --> 01:16:37,132 How can we help you, sir? 741 01:16:37,142 --> 01:16:39,067 You can sleep. 742 01:16:41,897 --> 01:16:44,457 - Gentlemen-- - Sleep. Sleep. 743 01:16:47,996 --> 01:16:49,274 Evening, sir. 744 01:16:57,850 --> 01:16:59,050 Bumstead. 745 01:17:02,064 --> 01:17:05,937 I wanted to be the first to congratulate you... about the case. 746 01:17:08,200 --> 01:17:11,027 Take us to Murdoch. 747 01:17:11,177 --> 01:17:12,182 Sleep. 748 01:17:39,701 --> 01:17:41,233 Dr. Schreber. 749 01:17:42,491 --> 01:17:44,132 I knew you'd come eventually. 750 01:17:44,262 --> 01:17:46,868 Don't you think it's about time you started giving me some answers? 751 01:17:46,869 --> 01:17:49,074 Yes. Yes, of course. 752 01:17:49,274 --> 01:17:51,010 Won't you please sit down? 753 01:17:53,902 --> 01:17:55,981 I come here quite often. 754 01:17:56,151 --> 01:17:58,543 It's one of the few places I'm allowed a moment's peace. 755 01:17:58,663 --> 01:18:02,280 You see, they have an aversion to water. 756 01:18:02,961 --> 01:18:04,886 One could almost call it a phobia. 757 01:18:05,484 --> 01:18:08,857 Who are they? What do they want from me? 758 01:18:08,997 --> 01:18:10,011 Right. 759 01:18:10,427 --> 01:18:12,551 Well, for now, let's just say... 760 01:18:12,591 --> 01:18:15,187 ...that you were the subject of their experiment. 761 01:18:15,287 --> 01:18:17,162 We all are. 762 01:18:18,657 --> 01:18:20,719 You're not crazy, John. 763 01:18:21,410 --> 01:18:23,363 And you are not a murderer. 764 01:18:25,420 --> 01:18:27,132 I'm sorry about this. I truly am. 765 01:18:27,352 --> 01:18:31,369 But we do not have much time and I cannot afford the luxury of doing this the right way. 766 01:18:31,450 --> 01:18:32,978 Everything you need to know... 767 01:18:33,100 --> 01:18:35,307 ...all the answers are in this syringe. 768 01:18:35,417 --> 01:18:38,921 I need you to inject yourself. It's the only way to make you understand. 769 01:18:39,110 --> 01:18:40,332 You're kidding me, right? 770 01:18:40,452 --> 01:18:43,320 We're running out of time, John. You have to do this now. 771 01:18:44,002 --> 01:18:45,424 Give me the gun, Doctor. 772 01:18:45,584 --> 01:18:47,862 Inspector, he is more disturbed than we thought. 773 01:18:47,863 --> 01:18:50,632 I may not be the judge of personality that you are, Doctor... 774 01:18:50,732 --> 01:18:53,606 ...but you're the one who looks disturbed to me. 775 01:18:54,183 --> 01:18:56,339 You do not know what you are doing. 776 01:18:57,636 --> 01:19:01,506 What, exactly is in this... Doctor? 777 01:19:02,974 --> 01:19:06,054 All the answers you've been looking for, John. I swear to you. 778 01:19:08,445 --> 01:19:12,147 Guess I'll just have to hold on to it for... safekeeping. 779 01:19:12,651 --> 01:19:15,520 - If you don't mind. - Let's go, Doctor. 780 01:19:16,638 --> 01:19:22,138 - Go? Where are we going? - Shell Beach. 781 01:19:23,295 --> 01:19:25,226 That's where you want to go, isn't it? 782 01:19:25,687 --> 01:19:27,006 The ocean. 783 01:19:36,091 --> 01:19:37,473 Why are you doing this? 784 01:19:39,494 --> 01:19:41,043 What do you hope to gain by helping me? 785 01:19:41,203 --> 01:19:42,519 The truth. 786 01:19:43,178 --> 01:19:46,431 None of these maps extend far enough to show the ocean. 787 01:19:46,551 --> 01:19:49,815 You won't find anything there. I promise you! I've been there, and-- 788 01:19:49,816 --> 01:19:52,199 If you've been there, you can show us the way, then, can't you? 789 01:19:53,205 --> 01:19:54,885 We'll see for ourselves. 790 01:19:56,201 --> 01:19:57,173 I won't! 791 01:19:58,423 --> 01:20:01,154 I refuse. You can't make me go there! 792 01:20:13,565 --> 01:20:15,514 You were saying, doctor? 793 01:20:27,329 --> 01:20:30,707 I don't understand. Used to be a bridge here. 794 01:20:37,666 --> 01:20:40,447 Try that again, your friends are gonna be fishing you out of the canal. 795 01:20:40,639 --> 01:20:43,833 Just don't hurt me. I'll tell you everything. It doesn't matter anymore anyway. 796 01:20:50,819 --> 01:20:51,962 What? 797 01:20:55,083 --> 01:20:56,966 Who are you people? 798 01:21:01,376 --> 01:21:05,813 We will give you some more pretty things soon... Anna. 799 01:21:06,198 --> 01:21:07,649 I'm not Anna. 800 01:21:09,397 --> 01:21:11,509 You will be soon, yes. 801 01:21:15,450 --> 01:21:18,101 I have another use for her first. 802 01:21:24,800 --> 01:21:30,169 First there was darkness. Then came the strangers. 803 01:21:32,124 --> 01:21:34,754 They abducted us and brought us here. 804 01:21:35,814 --> 01:21:37,942 This city, everyone in it... 805 01:21:38,787 --> 01:21:40,058 ...is their experiment. 806 01:21:40,228 --> 01:21:42,974 They mix and match our memories as they see fit... 807 01:21:42,975 --> 01:21:45,756 ...trying to divine what makes us unique. 808 01:21:46,234 --> 01:21:48,934 One day, a man might be an inspector. 809 01:21:49,027 --> 01:21:51,947 The next, someone entirely different. 810 01:21:52,354 --> 01:21:55,302 When they want to study a murderer for instance... 811 01:21:55,680 --> 01:22:00,156 ...they simply imprint one of their citizens with a new personality... 812 01:22:00,548 --> 01:22:04,518 ...arrange a family for him, friends, an entire history... 813 01:22:05,417 --> 01:22:06,421 ...even a lost wallet. 814 01:22:06,892 --> 01:22:08,573 Then they observe the results. 815 01:22:10,145 --> 01:22:11,513 Will a man, given the history... 816 01:22:11,643 --> 01:22:14,088 ...of a killer, continue in that vein? 817 01:22:14,412 --> 01:22:18,142 Or are we, in fact, more than the mere sum of our memories? 818 01:22:18,210 --> 01:22:22,917 This business of you being a killer was an unhappy coincidence. 819 01:22:23,388 --> 01:22:25,110 You have had dozens of lives before now. 820 01:22:26,069 --> 01:22:26,704 You just happened... 821 01:22:26,784 --> 01:22:29,905 ...to wake up while I was imprinting you with this one. 822 01:22:30,425 --> 01:22:32,291 Why are they doing all of this? 823 01:22:32,574 --> 01:22:35,384 It is our capacity for individuality... 824 01:22:35,621 --> 01:22:38,423 ...our souls that makes us different from them. 825 01:22:38,483 --> 01:22:40,826 They think they can find the human soul... 826 01:22:40,831 --> 01:22:43,658 ...if they understand how our memories work. 827 01:22:44,175 --> 01:22:48,051 All they have are collective memories. They share one group mind. 828 01:22:48,108 --> 01:22:49,628 They're dying, you see? 829 01:22:49,658 --> 01:22:52,828 Their entire race is on the brink of extinction. 830 01:22:53,178 --> 01:22:55,030 They think we can save them. 831 01:22:55,220 --> 01:22:57,528 - Where do I fit in? - You are different, John. 832 01:22:58,149 --> 01:23:00,755 You resisted my attempt to imprint you. 833 01:23:05,540 --> 01:23:06,317 Somehow... 834 01:23:06,429 --> 01:23:09,135 ...you have developed their ability to tune. 835 01:23:09,140 --> 01:23:11,980 That is how they change things. That is how they built this city. 836 01:23:12,243 --> 01:23:14,960 They have machines buried deep beneath the surface... 837 01:23:15,190 --> 01:23:18,836 ...that allow them to focus their telepathic energies. 838 01:23:19,844 --> 01:23:22,210 They control everything here, even the sun. 839 01:23:22,390 --> 01:23:25,416 That's why it's always dark. They can't stand the light. 840 01:23:25,480 --> 01:23:26,892 So why do they need you? 841 01:23:27,162 --> 01:23:30,907 When they first brought us here, they extracted what was in us. 842 01:23:31,289 --> 01:23:33,061 So they could store the information... 843 01:23:33,262 --> 01:23:35,209 ...remix it like so much paint... 844 01:23:35,350 --> 01:23:37,809 ...and give us back new memories of their choosing. 845 01:23:38,009 --> 01:23:41,460 But they still needed an artist to help them. 846 01:23:43,291 --> 01:23:46,424 I understood the intricacies of the human mind... 847 01:23:46,480 --> 01:23:48,294 ...better than they ever could... 848 01:23:48,894 --> 01:23:51,823 ...so they allowed me to keep my skills as a scientist... 849 01:23:51,973 --> 01:23:53,311 ...because they needed them. 850 01:23:53,411 --> 01:23:55,692 But they made me delete everything else. 851 01:24:04,275 --> 01:24:06,925 Can you imagine what it is like being forced... 852 01:24:07,245 --> 01:24:08,823 ...to erase your own past? 853 01:24:09,023 --> 01:24:12,385 What about my past? What about my childhood? 854 01:24:13,151 --> 01:24:15,382 Shell Beach, Uncle Karl. 855 01:24:16,641 --> 01:24:17,595 What about this? 856 01:24:18,773 --> 01:24:20,552 This was blank when I found it! 857 01:24:20,598 --> 01:24:22,657 You still don't understand, John. 858 01:24:22,677 --> 01:24:25,844 You were never a boy... not in this place. 859 01:24:25,883 --> 01:24:28,594 Your entire history is an illusion, a fabrication... 860 01:24:28,595 --> 01:24:30,278 ...as it is with all of us. 861 01:24:30,502 --> 01:24:33,198 You made those drawings happen with your gift. 862 01:24:33,338 --> 01:24:35,386 You say they brought us here. 863 01:24:36,818 --> 01:24:38,345 From where? 864 01:24:41,740 --> 01:24:42,866 I'm sorry. 865 01:24:43,789 --> 01:24:45,324 I don't remember. 866 01:24:45,920 --> 01:24:47,576 None of us remember that... 867 01:24:48,166 --> 01:24:49,718 ...what we once were... 868 01:24:50,001 --> 01:24:51,536 ...what we might have been... 869 01:24:52,450 --> 01:24:54,048 ...somewhere else. 870 01:25:11,132 --> 01:25:13,052 I've taken you this far. 871 01:25:13,334 --> 01:25:15,011 You don't need me anymore. 872 01:25:15,493 --> 01:25:16,490 Let's go. 873 01:25:35,413 --> 01:25:36,141 John. 874 01:26:01,276 --> 01:26:04,060 There is no ocean, John. 875 01:26:04,803 --> 01:26:07,617 There is nothing beyond the city. 876 01:26:08,573 --> 01:26:11,592 The only place home exists... 877 01:26:13,445 --> 01:26:15,381 ...is in your head. 878 01:26:23,935 --> 01:26:25,500 No! No! 879 01:26:25,678 --> 01:26:27,187 John, stop! 880 01:26:30,061 --> 01:26:30,674 No! 881 01:26:33,989 --> 01:26:34,885 Stop! 882 01:26:40,882 --> 01:26:41,578 Please! 883 01:26:42,927 --> 01:26:43,501 No! 884 01:27:02,654 --> 01:27:04,744 And now you know the truth. 885 01:27:24,135 --> 01:27:25,218 No! 886 01:28:13,228 --> 01:28:16,115 You'll allow yourself to surrender, Mr. Murdoch... 887 01:28:16,135 --> 01:28:17,847 ...or it will result in this one's death, yes? 888 01:28:18,187 --> 01:28:21,182 What do I care? She's not my real wife! 889 01:28:21,183 --> 01:28:22,280 She's nothing to me! 890 01:28:22,400 --> 01:28:26,551 But you do still care, don't you, Mr. Murdoch? 891 01:28:26,781 --> 01:28:31,200 You see, I have become the monster... you were intended to be. 892 01:28:33,047 --> 01:28:36,837 Shall I end her life now as you would have? 893 01:28:40,038 --> 01:28:41,720 Don't hurt her, please! 894 01:28:42,097 --> 01:28:45,789 Then surrender, Mr. Murdoch. 895 01:28:46,968 --> 01:28:48,517 Sleep. 896 01:28:50,588 --> 01:28:52,347 Now. 897 01:28:54,609 --> 01:28:55,634 John? 898 01:29:11,249 --> 01:29:12,270 Sleep. 899 01:29:34,245 --> 01:29:36,817 The doctor was right. He has evolved. 900 01:29:37,398 --> 01:29:38,914 Kill him. 901 01:29:39,054 --> 01:29:42,362 Kill him! Kill him! Kill him! 902 01:29:44,779 --> 01:29:47,459 Kill him! Kill him! Kill him! 903 01:29:50,224 --> 01:29:52,662 He is powerful, yes. 904 01:29:52,822 --> 01:29:57,198 Dangerous. But he can also lead us to what we seek. 905 01:29:57,318 --> 01:30:00,450 What the doctor calls the soul. 906 01:30:00,747 --> 01:30:04,372 It is time for our experiment to move into a final phase. 907 01:30:04,502 --> 01:30:07,111 We no longer need the other subjects. 908 01:30:07,241 --> 01:30:10,568 The time for study is over. 909 01:30:10,911 --> 01:30:15,150 It is time to be one with John Murdoch. 910 01:30:21,649 --> 01:30:25,088 It is time, Doctor. Imprint. 911 01:30:28,005 --> 01:30:30,259 Shut it down! 912 01:30:30,809 --> 01:30:33,715 Shut it down forever! 913 01:30:47,969 --> 01:30:49,095 What are you doing? 914 01:30:50,162 --> 01:30:54,560 They want to imprint you with their own collective memories. 915 01:30:56,023 --> 01:31:00,116 They want to make you one of them, so they can share your soul. 916 01:31:06,270 --> 01:31:08,549 Imprint, Doctor. No more disobedience. 917 01:31:08,809 --> 01:31:10,409 I'm sorry, John. 918 01:31:10,719 --> 01:31:13,227 The pain will only last a moment. 919 01:31:15,736 --> 01:31:16,508 No! 920 01:31:27,512 --> 01:31:29,538 You'll rise to greater heights than that, my boy. 921 01:31:29,748 --> 01:31:31,784 One day when you're older, you'll understand. 922 01:31:33,250 --> 01:31:34,306 Remember. 923 01:31:35,516 --> 01:31:38,399 That's it, John. Practice makes perfect. 924 01:31:38,529 --> 01:31:41,576 Now remember what I told you. Never talk to strangers. 925 01:31:41,766 --> 01:31:43,321 John, remember. 926 01:31:43,662 --> 01:31:46,344 You're probably wondering why I keep appearing in your memories. 927 01:31:46,444 --> 01:31:48,923 It is because I have inserted myself in them. 928 01:31:49,123 --> 01:31:51,787 All of these memories have been fabricated to teach you... 929 01:31:51,788 --> 01:31:52,904 ...about the strangers. 930 01:31:53,064 --> 01:31:55,987 Give you a lifetime of knowledge in a single syringe. 931 01:31:58,816 --> 01:32:00,635 You will survive, John. 932 01:32:01,301 --> 01:32:03,314 You will find strength within yourself... 933 01:32:03,574 --> 01:32:05,258 ...and you will prevail. 934 01:32:05,636 --> 01:32:06,903 Remember. 935 01:32:07,772 --> 01:32:09,829 - Hi, Uncle Karl. - Johnny! 936 01:32:12,890 --> 01:32:14,645 You're getting the hang of it, John. 937 01:32:14,996 --> 01:32:16,882 Maybe one day I'll be working for you. 938 01:32:17,875 --> 01:32:21,056 This is the machine the strangers use to amplify their thoughts. 939 01:32:21,258 --> 01:32:24,548 The machine that changes their world. You must take control of it. 940 01:32:24,709 --> 01:32:28,120 You must make the machine yours. I know you can beat them, John. 941 01:32:28,396 --> 01:32:30,725 But you must concentrate! 942 01:32:33,130 --> 01:32:34,797 Something's wrong. 943 01:32:42,853 --> 01:32:45,287 There is no time for romance, John. 944 01:32:45,553 --> 01:32:46,974 The world can be what you make it. 945 01:32:48,032 --> 01:32:49,079 What have you done? 946 01:32:50,139 --> 01:32:52,549 You have the power to make anything happen... 947 01:32:52,550 --> 01:32:54,344 ...but you must act now! 948 01:37:38,616 --> 01:37:40,424 I knew you could do it, John. 949 01:37:40,867 --> 01:37:42,486 You have their power now. 950 01:37:42,826 --> 01:37:45,476 - You control their machines. - Where's Emma? 951 01:37:46,474 --> 01:37:49,071 She is not Emma anymore, John. 952 01:37:49,313 --> 01:37:50,828 She has been reimprinted. 953 01:37:50,968 --> 01:37:54,786 - So give her back her memories. - I can't. The facility where the strangers... 954 01:37:54,787 --> 01:37:57,468 ...stored the memories has been destroyed. 955 01:37:57,998 --> 01:37:59,017 I'm sorry. 956 01:38:00,390 --> 01:38:02,611 What are you going to do now, John? 957 01:38:04,785 --> 01:38:08,271 You told me I had the power, didn't you? 958 01:38:08,873 --> 01:38:11,918 I can make these machines do anything I want. 959 01:38:12,900 --> 01:38:15,200 Make this world anything I want it to be. 960 01:38:16,210 --> 01:38:20,452 Just so long as I concentrate hard enough. 961 01:39:44,418 --> 01:39:45,526 Where are you going? 962 01:39:48,676 --> 01:39:50,045 Shell Beach. 963 01:40:31,078 --> 01:40:32,449 - What's the fare? - Quarter. 964 01:40:39,355 --> 01:40:43,493 - Oh, please. - Oh, no-- - It's fine. - Thank you. 965 01:41:23,851 --> 01:41:25,336 John... 966 01:41:29,349 --> 01:41:31,792 Been waiting for you, yes? 967 01:41:32,229 --> 01:41:36,439 - What are you doing? - I'm just making a few little changes around here, is all. 968 01:41:36,844 --> 01:41:38,485 Are we sure that's what we want? 969 01:41:38,906 --> 01:41:41,151 I'm prepared to take my chances. 970 01:41:41,475 --> 01:41:42,987 I'm dying, John. 971 01:41:43,197 --> 01:41:46,665 Your imprint is not agreeable with my kind. 972 01:41:47,501 --> 01:41:49,604 But I wanted to know what it was like... 973 01:41:51,068 --> 01:41:52,522 How you feel. 974 01:41:52,682 --> 01:41:55,116 You know how I was supposed to feel. 975 01:41:55,435 --> 01:41:59,174 That person isn't me. Never was. 976 01:41:59,444 --> 01:42:02,814 You wanted to know what it was about us that made us human. 977 01:42:04,321 --> 01:42:07,800 Well, you're not going to find it... in here. 978 01:42:09,263 --> 01:42:11,385 You went looking in the wrong place. 979 01:43:50,454 --> 01:43:52,061 It's so beautiful here. 980 01:43:57,514 --> 01:43:59,191 So bright. 981 01:44:05,048 --> 01:44:07,549 Do you know if Shell Beach is around here? 982 01:44:07,918 --> 01:44:10,452 I think that's it just over there. 983 01:44:28,575 --> 01:44:30,552 I'm headed that way myself. 984 01:44:32,579 --> 01:44:34,239 Would you like to join me? 985 01:44:36,893 --> 01:44:37,857 Sure. 986 01:44:43,430 --> 01:44:45,139 I'm Anna, by the way. 987 01:44:45,901 --> 01:44:48,260 - What's your name? - John. 988 01:44:50,491 --> 01:44:51,846 John Murdoch.
